751: Research EMBL Heidelberg The European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) is a world leader in scientific research in and at the forefront in the development of cutting-edge technologies. In order to support its research teams, EMBL has set up a number of core facilities which provide cutting-edge services to its scientists and visitors from its member states. These services include the Centre for Bioimage Analysis (CBA), which develops and provides solutions for image data analysis. To this end, the CBA closely collaborates with EMBL’s Bio-IT community and IT-Services to provide compute infrastructure and the Kreshuk lab to provide cutting edge machine learning solutions for image analysis. We are seeking a motivated software developer to support us in providing cloud hosted solutions for running both interactive and batch bioimage analysis tools and workflows. The position is embedded in the network of collaborating universities and research institutes within the NFDI4BIOIMAGE consortium (https://nfdi4bioimage.de) of the national infrastructure for research data management (NFDI, https://nfdi.de). The focus of work within NFDI4BIOIMAGE is on all steps of the research data life cycle for microscopy and bioimage analysis with the aim to provide solutions for the FAIR management of bioimage data, including standards for data file formats, tools for multimodal data integration, bioimage data analysis workflows and advanced training. Your role The successful candidate will work at the CBA at EMBL Heidelberg. (S)he will develop and maintain cloud solutions for deploying FAIR bioimage analysis tools and workflows. This will entail providing interactive image analysis tools via virtual desktops as well as providing scalable batch image analysis using cloud compatible workflow management systems such as Nextflow and Galaxy. The developed solutions shall be accessible and portable such that they can be used both at EMBL and within the above mentioned NFDI4BIOIMAGE network. Closing date: 19 May 2023 Contract duration: 5 years Grading: 5 Reference number: HD02398 You have Candidates should have a university degree in either life sciences, physics or engineering, preferably with a PhD. Hand-on experience with cloud technology such as virtual desktops, OpenStack or Kubernetes, software deployment and containerisation with tools such as conda or docker, and experience with workflow systems such as Nextflow or Galaxy are essential. The successful candidate should be a team player and have excellent communication and organisational skills. Fluency in English is compulsory. You might also have Experience in bioimage analysis and image data management is a plus. You may also have experience in training life scientists in using advanced compute infrastructures, such as the one you will develop. Why join us EMBL is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer offering attractive conditions and benefits appropriate to an international research organisation with a very collegial and family friendly working environment. The remuneration package comprises a competitive salary, a comprehensive pension scheme, medical, educational and other social benefits, as well as financial support for relocation and installation, including your family and the availability of an excellent child care facility on campus. What else you need to know We are Europe’s flagship research laboratory for the life sciences – an intergovernmental organisation performing scientific research in disciplines including molecular biology, physics, chemistry and computer science. We are an international, innovative and interdisciplinary laboratory with more than 1900 employees from many nations, operating across six sites, in Heidelberg (HQ), Barcelona, Hinxton near Cambridge, Hamburg, Grenoble and Rome. Our mission is to offer vital services in training scientists, students and visitors at all levels; to develop new instruments and methods in the life sciences and actively engage in technology transfer activities, and to integrate European life science research.
